title: Correlative Microscopy Evaluation of Surface and Sub-Surface Cracking of Additively Manufactured Haynes速-230
content: Haynes速-230 is Ni-Cr-W-Mo alloy that is known for its high temperature strength, thermal stability, and environmental resistance in applications such as: thermocouple protection tubes, heat exchangers, combustion cans, and transition ducts. The Additive Manufacturing (AM) of Haynes速-230 is being investigated to replace commonly used AM alloys such as Inconel 718 and 625 due to the benefits arising from a simpler composition, higher melting point, and greater rupture life. However, Haynes速-230 is not commonly processed using AM, due to cracks generated during the solidification process of the alloy.
